CLIFTON FADIMAN comments on the recent wine article written by our associate, Sam Aaron, for House Beautiful.

“Mr. Aaron is now the Wine Columnist for HOUSE BEAUTIFUL, a circumstance tending to make more possible the Life Satisfying. His article, here reprinted from that excellent publication, not only sup- plies positive information of rare utility, but is a splendid example of salutary de- structiveness. His five “Rules to Ignore” go to the heart of the matter. Those of us who have been bewildered by the abraca- dabra of temperature, aging, decanting, vintage years and wine-glasses need no longer remain in a state of befuddled in- timidation. Not that Mr. Aaron isa hearty, back-slapping, common man of Wine. He is an expert. He knows all about the rituals, nuances, the minutiae of the art of wine- drinking. But he has reduced them to com- mon sense. He not only tells us precisely how to go about building a “library” of wine for non-astronomical sums of money, but how to get the most enjoyment out of our collection, minus fuss, anxiety and timewasting.”’
